page.title: 19Adisham Recreations
page.content: Country pursuits were paramount in the area with walking, surfboarding, horse riding, fishing and golf. Team sports include spectators as well as partici- pants. There is now no village football team but the recreation ground is used by other teams. These are all in add- ition to the various club activities. Shooting is carried on locally for par- tridge, pheasant, rabbits and hares. Gardening is regarded as a necessity and some allotments are still used. Indoor sport outside the area covers swimming, roller skating, squash and snooker. Pastimes indoors include reading, writing, drinking and brewing beer. People go to whist drives in other villages; bridge, card games and dice are played. Adults also attended recreational classes in Canterbury. Herne Bay Majorettes attracted the small girls.
